channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Nappies scattered across the road, 28th July
item.description:
Dirty nappies and wipes are scattered on the road and pavement in this area There are also nappies and wipes dragged into 57 front gardens between 57 and 59 perhaps by foxes as well as dragged into the front gardens between of 59 with nappies under the evergreen bush behind the tree and in the lawn area
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albemarle Road, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Newly planted trees, 28th July
item.description:
Again, during a particularly dry period, your contractors have planted trees to replace the dead trees that didn’t survive the last one. This is happening elsewhere in our borough too. What a shameful waste of money that we don’t have. The issue will be taken up with our ward councillors.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Partridge Green, Coldharbour, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog or Human Poop and OverFlowed Water, 28th July
item.description:

item.title: Littering, 28th July
item.description:
Furrow Lane has NOT been swept since last week WEDNESDAY. Can we please have the road swept!!! The dustman ONLY picks up large bits of rubbish. The road NEEDS to be swept. How many times do the residents of Furrow Lane need to complaint to get this done !!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Furrow Lane, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
